body.p:
Frankfort
10th June 1861
To the Ky. Millitary Board
Gentln
I submit to you herewith two a short letter from Mr Senator Wait on the subject of the manufacture of Gun Powder.

I know the fact that he owns a large quantity of Mountain lands on both sides of the Cumberland River in the vicinity of the Mouth of Rockcastle River in Pulaski & Whitley Counties I know also that the caves of thar region are numerous and abound in Salt Petre, and believe gunpowder can be manufactured as cheap there as at any other point in Kentucky The location is secure from invasion and but little danger of Negro insurrection or incendiarism.
Mr Wait is a reliable man.
